home_description: Discover, collect and trade NFTs easily with Dagora
home_faq1_title: How do I list my NFT on Dagora?
home_faq1_description: We support various ways of listing NFTs, including launchpad, drop and verified collection. Please review this docs to know how to launch your NFT on Dagora.
home_faq2_title: What are the fees on Dagora?
home_faq2_description: NFT marketplaces typically charge a commission fee for each sale, which can vary depending on the platform. Dagora offers 0% listing fee, 2% trading fee and optional royalty fees.
home_faq3_title: Can I trade NFTs for other cryptocurrencies or assets?
home_faq3_description: Dagora supports users to trade NFTs for other blockchain native tokens (BNB, SOL, MATIC, etc.), stable coins (CUSD, USDC, BUSD, etc.,) and others.
home_faq4_title: Which blockchains is Dagora compatible with?
home_faq4_description: Dagora is a multi-chain NFT marketplace and launchpad supporting EVM blockchains (Ethereum, Polygon, BNB chain, etc.) and non-EVM blockchains (Solana, Sei Network, etc.). You can switch from one blockchain to another in just a few clicks.
home_instruction_title: How to create an NFT on multiple blockchains?
home_instruction_2: Upload your NFT. Set the price. Mint

term_user_agree: By entering this website and/or using our Services, you hereby agree, represent, and warrant that:
term_user_agree_1: You will be solely responsible for proceeding at your own discretion.
term_user_agree_2: You are not currently using, and will not use in the future, a VPN to mask your physical location from a restricted location.
term_user_agree_3: You are responsible for ensuring compliance with the laws of your jurisdiction in connection with your use of our Services.
term_user_agree_4: You understand that Dagora is not liable for your compliance or non-compliance with any such laws.

term_restricted_countries: Afghanistan, Albania, Barbados, Burkina Faso, Burundi, Cote d'Ivoire, Cayman Islands, Central African Republic, De mocratic Republic of Congo, Democratic People's Republic of Korea (DPRK), Eritrea, Gibraltar, Guinea-Bissau, Haiti, Jamaica,  Jordan, Lebanon, Libya, Mali, Mozambique, North Korea, Panama, Puerto Rico, Senegal, South Africa, South Sudan, Somalia, Sudan, Syria, Tanzania, Uganda, United Arab Emirates, Yemen, Iran, Iraq, Myanmar, Venezuela, Zimbabwe, Cuba, Hong Kong SAR, Macau SAR, United States of America or its territories or possessions or any other restricted country. listing_market_fee_tooltip: When you make a sale, Dagora keeps a portion of {marketFee}% on your selling price.
listing_royalty_fee_tooltip: It is set up for each collection and is calculated as the Royalties Fee multiplied by the transaction price to the collection owner.
listing_potential_earnings_tooltip: The total amount the seller can receive after deducting all fees.

auction_invalid_start_bid: Start Bid must be greater than 0.0001
auction_invalid_max_bid: Max Bid must be greater than Start Bid
auction_approve_item_content: To get set up for this action, you must approve this item for auction, which requires a one-time gas fee.
auction_approve_content:
Once the auction starts, your NFT will be held in an escrow wallet and you will NOT be able to cancel the listing if it gets any bids, and the auction will end on {expireTime}. 

After this point, the NFT will be released to the highest bidder once you or the winner settles the auction. Should no bid be placed, the NFT will be returned to you once you settle the auction.
